meanings.definition: Misstarts: plural noun form of misstart, meaning false or incorrect starts
meanings.sent1: The misstarts in the race confused the spectators.
meanings.sent2: She made several misstarts before finally getting it right.
meanings.sent3: The misstarts in the play rehearsal added some unexpected humor.
meanings.sent4: His misstarts in the dance routine were like a broken record.
meanings.sent5: The misstarts in the experiment led to a series of mishaps.

meanings.definition: Misstarts: third person singular present tense of misstart, meaning to make a false or incorrect start
meanings.sent1: He misstarts every morning by hitting the snooze button too many times.
meanings.sent2: The engine misstarts when the weather is too cold.
meanings.sent3: The comedian misstarts his jokes on purpose to keep the audience on their toes.
meanings.sent4: Her day misstarts like a car engine struggling to turn over.
meanings.sent5: The team's misstarts in the game cost them the victory.
